That's reflected here, and so it's significantly harder to get a decisive result, and you're more likely to see epic slugfests in which you win only because the other side collapsed an eye-blink sooner.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Wasteland Express Delivery Service: Rocker
Description:
Was part of the pledge level for backing the Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter campaign.  Also included in the Wasteland Express Delivery Service: Promo Pack 1.

An ally card.

Text says:
In combat, you may reveal a second raider card (replacing the first)

Name: Last Wan Standing
Description:
You and your buddies just got back from a big heist... but now you can't decide how to split up the haul. As you reach for your guns one question runs through everyone's mind - who will be the Last Wan Standing?

Each turn players will reveal a target and a numbered bullet chip. The numbered bullet determines how quickly you shoot, and the target determines who you shoot at. The catch is that the numbered bullets aren't re-usable, so you have to decide if you want to save your quickest shots for later in the round or not. There are other complications, like the "Down" chip that lets you dodge most bullets, your secretly selected "amigo" who you can't get target and get points for avenging, or the "quick draw" target chip that lets you defeat anyone shooting you on the same number, that allow for surprising plays.

Note: "wan" is the Japanese word for "woof" and is pronounced the same as "one".

—user summary

Name: The Ultimate Skirmish Game
Description:
These rules will enable you to play skirmish or adventure games, using 40mm or 28mm miniatures, from any era of history from the Prehistoric right through to the Napoleonic wars. Games can be played with as few as 2 figures and up to about 30 figures a side. Rules for stealth, fist fighting, martial arts. multiple combats, cavalry, spears and a whole host of other weapon types are included. Most games can be played in a couple of hours and so are suitable for club nights. Although these rules were primarily designed for our 40mm Samurai range, they could be used with our 28mm Prehistoric Settlement. These rules will also help you find a use for all those part finished armies that we all have. As you only need a small number of figures, taking up a new period need not be a vast and time consuming occupation.

The game has a Character development section, enabling the Player to chart the progress of their Characters. So who knows maybe your peasant can make it and become a Warrior or even a Hero!

—description from the publisher

Name: マモノノ～まものの喚(よ)び方～ (Mamonono)
Description:
Mamonono is a game about demon summoning. You start off with loyalty, and have to use loyalty to bid on magic stones of different colors. Using the magic stones you can summon demons, but each demon has different requirements for the type of stones to summon them. Summoned demons give you victory points, loyalty points you can use to get more stones, and also have other effects like altering the rules for bidding or allowing you to steal demons from other players.

Can you build the most powerful demon army?

—user summary

Name: Sagoleken
Description:
A fairy-tale based tricktaking game. The game consists of a number of playing cards and bonus cards. The tricks are played with the playing cards, the winner drawing a bonus card, keeping it hidden unless it's a princess which is kept face up.
The bonus cards consist of princes, lands, princesses and dragons. A combination of prince, land and princess forms a kingdom, worth points. A dragon can steal a face-up, non-kingdomed princess, and can be stolen back with a prince plus a certain combination of playing cards.

Once all three princesses are in Kingdoms, the game ends, and the player with most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Blood Moon
Description:
Werewolves have descended on the isolated village of High Rock, leaving death and destruction in their wake. Separated from their usual companions, the rangers must rely on a group of auxiliary soldiers to lead them to the village, help fight the werewolves, and hopefully rescue any survivors. However, as the rangers investigate the scene, it becomes increasingly clear that one of those auxiliaries is hiding a deadly secret…

Rangers of Shadow Deep: Blood Moon is a mini-expansion consisting of a one-scenario mission. It includes profiles for four unique companions, two new monsters, and full rules for becoming infected with lycanthrope.

—description from the designer

Name: Alien Artifacts: Santi Fleet Faction Promo
Description:
Take control of a new faction called the Santi Fleet in which the operate of the ship is the ship! Increase your options with with the Alien Artifacts: Factions Promo.

—description from the publisher

Name: Las Divas
Description:
Las Divas is a deduction-party card game in which each player becomes a fabulous Drag Queen of the Haus of Las Divas, the biggest, greatest and shiniest drag theater of Buenos Aires. In every show, the fierce competition between queens makes them give everything on stage, making the crowd go wild each night. But, who’s the best of the best? Which queen deserves to be recognized as the Divaest Diva of the show? It’s time for you to put on your heels, gown, nails and wig and show you deserve the crown, even if that implies sabotaging your fellow queens…

Setup: Each player gets one of four secret Divas, indicating with which card and how many copies of them in front of them, they have to get to win the game. If you’re Miss Kitty, the comedian, you’ll have to get 5 Laugh cards to become victorious. If you’re Pink Lemonade, the fashionista, you win with 4 Fame cards. Katie Hart, the showgirl, wins with 4 Spotlight cards and Lee O’poldo, the evil queen, wins when another player gets 4 Shade cards in their area.

So, there’s a deck with these four cards: Laugh, Fame, Spotlight and Shade. You get 4 initial cards. In your turn, you draw one card from the deck and play one of the cards in your hand in front of you (or if it’s Shade, in front of another player). Clockwise, players will draw and play cards until one reveals their secret identity, showing it accomplished their objective, winning the game.

But that’s not all! Each card, when played and even on the table, has an especial effect. Fame cards allow you to play additional cards in your turn. Shade cards cancel Fame cards and allows you to steal cards from that player’s hand. Laugh cards makes you switch a cards position on the table from one player or another. And finally, with the Spotlight cards, you draw 3 cards and discard 2. Every card is useful, even if they doesn’t make you win the game directly!
Balance is settled with card mix and double cards, that you can play using one of the sides only (and remain in that position even when stolen) and also affect the winning condition, making players hard to deduce how wins each player.

Las Divas is a game of temporal alliances, betrayal, deception and fabulous-ness, encouraging players to act like be a queen, making drama, stealing the show and revealing their hidden talents.

It was published in Argentina in 2018, thanks to a succesful crowdfunding campaign.

—description from the designer

Name: What Do You Meme?: Mean Girls Expansion Pack
Description:
What Do You Meme? Mean Girls Expansion Pack. We made fetch happen with the groolest expansion pack yet! Your chance to meme Cady, The Plastics, Janice, and more! The limit of memes doesn't exist! 50 Photo Cards and 50 Caption Cards to be added to core game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Small Star Empires: 5-6 Player Expansion
Description:
From back of box:
This expansion enables you to play Small Star Empires with up to 6 players! Includes all of the base game player components as well as the main expansions’ player components (Battle and Research Stations and additional markers).

Contains: 
Purple and Gray player sets each including: 4 Ships, 16 Cities, 4 Trade Stations, 3 Battle Stations, 3 Research Stations, 1 Homeworld Sector, 1 Cube (Power Marker), 3 Discs (Player abilities markers and score marker).

Name: Expect Delays
Description:
Expect Delays is a 10-20 min deck de-builder for 2 or 4 players all about the joys of riding public transit. Players take on the role of busy commuters desperately trying to get to work via an underfunded and barely operating subway system.

Players share access to a deck of trains they use to move commuters along their train lines. On their turn players may board riders, run lines, repair trains, or take trains out of service by removing them from the shared deck. Players must utilize this tug-of-war style deck building to make sure their commuters can progress further then those on the opponents line. The player with the most destination points when the deck runs out of cards and the subway comes to a grinding halt, wins the game.

—description from the publisher
Families: Components: Game Box Used In Play

Name: Treta do Anzol
Description:
In the card game Treta do Anzol, you enter a family fishing contest. Unfortunately, fish is not the only thing that you are pulling up, there are also monsters, mermaids and other strangenesses. If you manage to get some fishes, you need to protect them from cats, and, of course, from your jealous relatives.

A player turn consists of two phases: The fishing phase, in which the player draws a card from the "pond" pile and puts it on their character card. The fish card a character holds shows a number which determines how many cards they can play in the second phase, the action phase. In this phase, players try to cheat the other players out of their catch. Over the course of the game, players try to protect their catch and cheat others out of theirs. At some point, a "final player" card appears in the pile that triggers the game end. Whoever holds most points from their catch in the end is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Small Star Empires: Supermassive Black Hole
Description:
Mini-expansion for Small Star Empires.

Explore the secrets of the Supermassive Black Hole with your survey ships and stay clear of its strong gravitational field, as it can pull your ships and destroy them!

Push your luck to score as much points as possible!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Suburbia: Collector's Edition
Description:
Suburbia Collector’s Edition is a revamped version of the classic game Suburbia by Bezier Games. Suburbia fans old and new will fall in love with the updated three dimensional artwork, city-specific recessed borough boards, oversized tiles, and giant tile tower. This beautiful collectors edition features several amazing Game Trayz organizers and includes all existing expansions as well as a brand new one: Nightlife, which has buildings and locations that are more active in the evening hours.

This strategic tile-laying game has players use hex-shaped building tiles to create their own unique city. These tiles include residential, commercial, civic, and industrial areas, as well as special points of interest that provide benefits and take advantage of the resources of nearby places. Your goal is to have your city thrive and end up with the greatest population.

Each player builds up their own economic engine and infrastructure that will be initially self-sufficient, and eventually become both profitable and increase your population. As your city grows, you'll increase both your income (giving you more cash to spend) and your reputation (growing your population). The winner is the player with the largest population.

During each game, players compete for unique goals that offer additional population boosts - and with the many varying buildings and properties, you’ll never play the same game twice!

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Small Star Empires: Civilization and Tiles Pack
Description:
Includes:
2 Civilization boards (Argon Marauders and Thorian Assembly)
4 Main sector tiles

Name: Red Poppies Campaigns: Volume 3 – Assault Artillery: La Malmaison
Description:
Assault Artillery (AA) recounts the Battle of La Malmaison, 23-27 October 1917, in which the French employed their Artillerie Spéciale (tank force) and creeping barrage to capture Pinon, Vaudesson, and the coveted Chemin des Dames ridge. The French victory confirmed their recovery from the mutinies spawned by the disastrous Nivelle Offensive fought over some of the same ground six months earlier.

In a six-day preliminary bombardment, French guns, with a three to one advantage, silenced most of their German counterparts and smothered German rear areas with dense gas to impeded German reinforcements. At 0515 on October 23 (zero hour), six divisions of the French XI, XIV, and XXI corps attacked on a 7.5-mile wide front. French infantry advanced in the predawn twilight behind an elaborate creeping barrage with 63 Schneider and Saint-Chamond tanks in support. Twenty-seven of the 63 tanks bogged before reaching the front line. A combination of German fire and mud stopped 15 more in no man's land. Twenty-one French tanks (1/3rd of the starting total) actually made it to the German second position. The French 38th Division captured Fort de Malmaison and XXI Corps took Allemant and Vaudesson. From 24 to 25 October, XXI and XIV corps advanced while I Cavalry Corps came forward to exploit a hoped-for German collapse.

With specialized “eingreif” companies sprinkled all along the front, the Germans launched numerous local counterattacks. However, the French wave was inexorable. Still, the German 7th Army retired from the Chemin-des-Dames to the north bank of the Ailette in good order.

By October 26, the French had gained 3.5 miles in some places at a cost of only 12,000 casualties, far fewer than Germany’s 38,000 and a significant improvement over the 30,000 French losses suffered in the same area during April’s Nivelle Offensive. The French also bagged about 11,500 German prisoners. The Artillerie Spéciale proved its worth by smothering numerous German machine gun posts.

AA is the third volume in the Red Poppies Campaign (RPC) system for gaming World War I battles. Ownership of previous volumes, The Battles for Ypres and/or Last Laurels at Limanowa, is NOT required to play AA; everything you need to play AA is in this box. AA offers the same rules as The Battles for Ypres and Last Laurels at Limanowa except that sections 12 and 13, the scenarios and campaigns for volumes I and II, are intentionally left blank while section 14, the AA scenarios and campaigns, has been added.

Complexity: 6 out of 10
Solitaire suitability: 8 out of 10
Time Scale: 10 minutes per turn
Map Scale: 200 yards per hex
Unit Scale: Companies, squadrons, sections

—description from the publisher

Name: Schutztruppe: Heia Safari 1914-1918
Description:
Schutztruppe, Heia Safari, 1914-18 delivers an intriguing and detailed look at the East African Guerrilla war, 1914-1918. This is a moderate complexity wargame with detailed naval and supply rules, and a map and order of battle representing the authoritative treatment of the campaign. The overall game presentation is enhanced with a mounted game map and larger 9/16" counters.

Heia, heia Safari! was a call which for four years echoed throughout East Africa. With this call the officers of the Schutztruppe in German East Africa rallied and encouraged their askari in the defense of their country during the First World War. This small force, whose strength never exceeded 3,000 white and 12,000 black soldiers (askari), was opposed by some 300,000 men (150,000 at any one time), comprising British, Indian, Rhodesian, Nigerian, Gold Coast, South African, Belgian and Portuguese troops. Led by Major-General Paul von Lettow-Vorbeck, the Schutztruppe fought within its own home territory for the first three years of the war. During the final year von Lettow-Vorbeck transferred his resistance to Portuguese East Africa and trekked south to within 60 km of Quelimane. He reappeared in Northern Rhodesia in November, 1918, and that is where news of the general armistice that ended the war reached him.

Forces represent the German, British, South African, Portuguese, and Belgian combatants. Special rules provide a game that is highly-playable yet rich in historical detail featuring weather effects, supply and supply depots, replacements, provisional reinforcements, rail movement, naval transport, naval battle, amphibious assault, aircraft, blockade runners, garrisons, German retreat movement, Allied ambush, infiltration movement, land and naval reaction, artillery bombardment, and more.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Cannae-Lite: The Battles of Herdonia, 212 and 210 BC
Description:
The Battles of Herdonia, 212 & 210 BC, is GMT's Battle Scenario for SPQR, published in RBM's C3i Magazine Nr. 20.

After Cannae, most Roman generals accepted the wisdom of Fabius the 'Delayor'; against Hannibal, discretion was definitely the better part of valor. Fortunately for the historical wargaming community, two generals were foolish enough to accept Hannibal's challenge, both names Fulvius, and both on the field before Herdonia. As had occured at Cannae, both these armies were also envelopped and annihilated. Unlike Cannae, at the Herdonia battles Rome fielded only two, not eight, legions. So here is an opportunity to fight Cannae-Lite, two classic battles of envelopment, scaled down to one-quarter of Cannae's monumental size.

Contents:

     Herdonia Setup Card.
     21 new counters.


Expansion module for the Great Battles of History (GBoH) series game SPQR.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Great Battles of History (GMT Games)
